alert.note: Alert for Ozark; Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 10:33AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Ozark, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1033 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Roark Creek at Expressway Lane, Trigger Creek at Highway J, Pond Fork at County Road 883 and Wolf Creek at Highway 125. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Reeds Spring, Rockaway Beach, Indian Point, Branson West, Kissee Mills, Table Rock, Theodosia, Kirbyville, Pontiac, Coney Island, Sundown, Powersite, Ozark Beach, Edgewater Beach, Rueter, Protem, Long Run, Isabella, Lake Taneycomo, Bull Shoals Lake, Table Rock Lake, Table Rock State Park and Shepherd of the Hills State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
